H0.text: Electromagnetic spectrum is the full range of wavelengths and frequencies of electromagnetic radiation.

H1.text: Electronic spectrum is the full range of wavelengths and frequencies of electromagnetic radiation.

H2.text: Mechanical spectrum is the full range of wavelengths and frequencies of electromagnetic radiation.

H3.text: Anomalous spectrum is the full range of wavelengths and frequencies of electromagnetic radiation.

A4.text: The electromagnetic spectrum is the full range of electromagnetic radiation, organized by frequency or wavelength.

A5.text: The types of electromagnetic radiation are broadly classified into the following classes (regions, bands or types): Gamma radiation, X-ray radiation, Ultraviolet radiation, Visible light (light that humans can see), Infrared radiation, Microwave radiation, Radio waves.
